title-group.article-title: What Was Tragedy? The World We Have Lost, 1550–1795

p.mixed-citation: "It so happened that the knife-edge of his judgment hit square on one masterpiece, the Oedipus; but the other play it hit upon, the Iphigenia, cannot honestly be called much more than a good melodrama" (446).
